history.content:
188 needs mainly the probability portion of 70, so STAT 140 should cover that well. There is some graph theory content, but that shouldn't be hard to self-study.

That's not a bad schedule, in my experience 188 assignments are pretty easy / low time effort. For comparison, the homework is easier than CS 70 or any pset class homework, and the projects are lower effort than 61b. The main thing that will get you is the exams and understanding the content: there's a lot to understand in order to do well on the midterm.

If you haven't taken 3 techs in a semester before I'd be hesitant, but if you have you should be ok.

<md>
I'm trying to declare CS, and want to spend more time on CS 70 this fall, so I'm trying to take a light schedule (EECS 16A + CS 70 + breadth + decal). But I was wondering if it's a good idea to do CS 188 instead of a breadth - does 188 require the discrete math portion of 70 or probability? I'm in STAT 140 right now, so will that take care of the prob. requirements for 188? 

Also - is it a good idea to do 16A + CS 70 + CS 188 + decal in one semester? I've heard that 188 is regarded as an easier upper-div, but also heard that it's gotten harder over the years...
</md>

Edit: I'm in Data 100 right now, so that's one UD that I can't take.. just in case someone is thinking of recommending that.
history.subject: CS 188 along with CS 70 doable?
